website_summaries.verdict: With a superb balance of comfort, support, and breathability these premium socks are fast becoming the go-to choice for active individuals from all walks of life.
pros: Seamless toe prevents irritation and eliminates blisters
Heel tab keeps socks in place
Cushioned soles Provide superior comfort without feeling bulky
cons: On the higher end of price spectrum

customer_reviews.title: Likely counterfeit item. ☹️
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable, but not like any Belega I own. I believe I received counterfeit socks. Packaging says, "Made in China." Balega manufactures in South Africa and North Carolina only. Some wording on the packaging is "off." Logo embroidery on the socks is larger, and the elastic band around the ankle is missing.
customer_reviews.author: clinster

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable socks I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: The socks are not too thin nor too thick. Just perfect. I played basketball with it as well as train for a 10k run with it. My feet always felt cool while just having enough protection from blisters. I wear a sz 9 shoes and the M fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: AaronJ

customer_reviews.title: great exercise sock
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I just wish they came in tan!
customer_reviews.author: P. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: My new favorites
customer_reviews.text: I have NEVER liked no-show socks, and I was reluctant to try these, but they were highly rated and recommended. I love this socks. I will repeat that. I love these socks. They do NOT slip down. Recently wore them for a half marathon in the rain and they did not budge. My new favorite running socks. I want all colors.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ready

customer_reviews.title: Huge! Mismarked Size
customer_reviews.text: In this attachment 3 pairs of socks are shown. 2 small ones are previous Mediums I've ordered. Larger one? That's the Medium most recently received. I've ordered several pairs of these aka my favorite socks. This pair was marked medium but no way in the world were these correct. Proof? I gave them to my big foot husband and they fit him perfectly. Now I still need new socks though. Feel like I can't trust getting correct size sight unseen so it's off to big box retail.
customer_reviews.author: Kanstey

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as previous identical socks
customer_reviews.text: I've bought over 10 pairs of this exact sock (Baelga XL), style (Hidden Comfort) and color (White) within the past 2yrs. This last pair I purchased a few days ago, purchased from Amazon, is lower quality. The fabric weaving is at least 40% looser and they are bigger in fit (same size) as my previous pair. I could tell the difference immediately when I put them on. I thought washing them would tighten the weaving, but it didn't. Either this was a fluke (doubt it since each pair has a sticker on them with a picture from a Balega Quality Control employee showing it passed inspection) or they are making them cheaper now...
customer_reviews.author: BradJ

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing between colors, peeling after 2 washes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair at Fleet Feet and absolutely loved them based on comfort. I have sciatic nerve damage and the added comfort helped relieve a bit of the nerve pain in my right foot. I ordered 10 more pair in nearly every color. The picture of 8 of them shows the sizes variations between colors. All of these are size Large. The yellow is considerably smaller then the rest and the blue was too large. The last picture shows identical product where the bottom sock is new, and the top sock is after 2 washes. Significant peeling after only 2 washes. Hopefully they hold up and the $140 I just spent wasn’t a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Russ H.

customer_reviews.title: Sock Slip!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands and several lines from various brands recently, and of all the socks I've tried, these were the only to have slipped into my shoes during my workout. They have great cushion but they're not nearly as snug on my feet as the others, nor is the tab thick enough to prevent the sock from slipping too far into the shoe. I wish I had noticed the reviews speculating these might not be genuine Balega socks. I'd be willing to try these socks again if I could be sure these were a genuine product and not a knock-off.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Typical Counterfeit Amazon Trash
customer_reviews.text: Packaging says 'Made in South Africa' in one place and 'Made in China' in another. Total garbage. Paid full price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S

customer_reviews.title: Very Good in Comparison
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing a good exercise sock and decided to purchase several brands/styles to compare. Models Compared: * Rockay Accelerate Anti-Blister Running Socks *** Balega Hidden Comfort No-Show Running Socks * Balega Blister Resist No Show Running Socks * Thirty 48 Running Socks for Men and Women -CoolMax Fabric * LITERRA Women's Hidden Athletic Cushion Single Tab Running Socks These right up there at the top: Pros: 1. Comfortable to wear. 2. Some compression. 3. Moderate cushion. 4. During my hour+ workout on a striding machine, there was little to no slippage. Cons: 1. While there was some compression, they could use a tad more. 2. The moderate cushion could be increased a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Keighlar

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, terrible knock off
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, terrible knock off. I didn’t notice when I bought the gray/carbon version of this sock if it was sold by amazon or not. But I’m living out of the country and it took a long time to get them down here through a family member. Now it’s too late to ask for a return. But these $13 a pair socks can’t be balegas. They are falling apart after the 2nd use! The fabric is rough and details are not correct. Looks like a cheap knockoff and man I’m a bummed. Be careful when you purchase!
customer_reviews.author: E Train

customer_reviews.title: WTF  This will cause blisters  NO quality Control. CRAP
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on the good Reviews, 0 Stars NOT USABLE The inside is Full of Over Stich. 2 Seven in Long Strips of Extra Stich on Each Side on the top of the Sox. it's about 3/4" to 1" Long plus some 2" long Heavy thread that Are sure to rub the Skin off your Foot. it has a tag that looks real, WAY OVERE PRICED FOR SOC YOU NEED TO HAND TRIM FOR A HOUR TO BE ABLE TO USE, WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN OR EVER!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Hidden Comfort is the Perfect Name, because it is truly Hidden.
customer_reviews.text: These are the thinnest socks I've ever purchased. There is absolutely ZERO cushion or pile in the heel or toe regions. I have purchase Chinese made footies from WalMart for a third of the price that eclipse these in comfort and quality. I threw them in the trash to save somebody else from being resold this product due to my return. Without question, the most useless garbage I've ever purchased from Amazon in the eleven years I have been a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Hasselblad Hal

customer_reviews.title: These are some really wonderful socks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple pair of these Balega Hidden Comfort socks at a local athletic shoe store awhile ago. I just bought another pair on Amazon. For years I’ve been wearing another brand of merino wool socks. But all the socks from this company always compressed my feet. That’s part of what I love about these Balega socks: they don’t compress my feet. But they also don’t stretch out with wear. They have just the right amount of cushion. Also my feet don’t sweat in them. And they cost about half what my old brand does. So I think I’m going to throw away the old brand, which I’ve had since 2010, and stock up on these Balega’s.
customer_reviews.author: St. Louis Cards

customer_reviews.title: Good feel and size
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time with this brand of sock, on first use they are soft and of good thickness without being thick. The feel is like a good quality new balance or other brand name socks. I have wide feet size 13 and the XL size worked perfect. It has on the back of the sock a slight additional cushion that helps with the edge of the shoe especially when running. The did not ride down the shoe like other have in the past for me. Responded well to first wash but I cannot really say much on the long term aspect yet. Base on my early experience, I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: My workout friend recommended these socks and insisted I try them. I was actually looking for a no-show sock so this was bulkier than I would like but I put them on and gave them a try and they are absolutely very comfortable. They show more material above the shoe than I would like. She purchased her originals at Nordstrom for significantly more. I am a size 7 women’s and I purchased a small. I wish they had an extra small since I would prefer them to be more snug.
customer_reviews.author: Tangled mess

customer_reviews.title: Can't be the real deal. Overpaid for product.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are not from the same place. I ordered two pair. The black pair I ordered fit perfectly and the white pair were tight around the top of my foot. I have about 10 pair of these socks and 90% of the time they are perfect. One was from Africa and the other was from Turkey. I tossed out both tags when I tried on the black pair. Not sure which factory was at fault.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Allred

customer_reviews.title: You Don't Know What You're Missing
customer_reviews.text: While I have never been someone to get the cheapest possible option, I never tried premium exercise attire before this - now I cannot help but notice how little comfort every other pair of socks provides. Wearing these socks with vans feels as comfortable as wearing standard socks with quality running shoes. Even after several months of regular use (always a first choice when they're clean!), they still feel great. Once races start up again this will be the only pair of socks I will wear.
customer_reviews.author: Dom Forziati

customer_reviews.title: There are better Balega socks out there
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pairs of Balega socks in another style which I love. I thought I'd try this style, because it had a lot of great reviews, fun colors, and a cheaper price. I noticed right away that even though all three pairs are size medium, and I used the size chart, this style was noticeably larger. I wore them to go for a run and found them to wear warmer. My feet were hot afterwards, that I actually had to take my socks off for a bit. Otherwise, they do have good cushion. **After reading other reviews, it seems these socks may be conterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: Megan C

customer_reviews.title: Slips off of ankle - Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these socks. I bought a different style from this same company, and they’ve been great. Unfortunately, these socks slip down under my heel almost immediately when walking. Poorly designed. Try these instead: Balega Silver Antimicrobial No-Show Compression-Fit Running Socks for Men and Women (1-Pair), Black/Carbon, Large
customer_reviews.author: John Loiacono IV

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks, Worth $$
customer_reviews.text: These socks are awesome. 3 pairs originally were gifted to me last year, because the gifter knew I would NEVER pay this much for a pair of socks despite the fact I run 5 days a week and 30-35 miles per week. That being said I needed more socks and guess what I spent MY hard earned money on...these socks. Best praise I can give. Love the way they feel on my feet. Have run mini-marathons with them with no blisters or other foot challenges. I give the socks some credit (but I also believe the shoes deserve quite a bit, if not more, credit).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love them. These are great socks. Very comfortable. Great material. Love the bright colors. Thin enough to fit great in sneakers, with an extra layer of cushion on the bottom. Working 13 hour shifts on my feet as a nurse, these are a favorite. I do wish the sizing was described by shoe sizes. I ordered a large... woman’s size 8 shoe typically. The large are a bit too big. They still feel great, but aren’t “no show”. I’m hoping after washing this pair, they might for just right.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Erin Stier

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Everything that I have read about Balega socks gives me no indication that they are made in Turkey. I’m seeing multiple reviews that are questioning the authenticity of these socks. Too expensive to not have the true socks. Ordered directly from and shipped by Amazon. Is this not even a guarantee for their customers any longer? A company that is as structured as Amazon should not be selling items that aren’t authentic. Please look in to it and pull these socks if they’re not the real deal, and improve your quality control! I’m returning these socks and ordering directly from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: MelH

customer_reviews.title: best no show athletic sock i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: best no show athletic sock i have ever owned. This is my 3rd order, in white this time. I can't express how good these feel. I am diabetic and do a lot of long distance walking for exercise. Socks with seems cause irritation. Socks with cotton bunch up and rub toes raw, both making walking for excercise painful and hard to stay commited to. These socks eliminate any foot discomfort i experience. I have tried many other brands, and nothing worked. These work, buy them you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: No blisters
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure - I am not a hardcore exerciser/runner. I am a out of shape individual who started walking daily to try to change that. I am prone to blisters and my marathon running best friend recommended these socks. The first time I wore them I noticed that I didn't get the hot spots I got with my regular socks. No hint of blisters at all since I started wearing these. My only complaint is they seem a bit large...I wear a 9 and the mediums leave extra material at the toe or heel.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with durability
customer_reviews.text: While these were admittedly much more comfortable than the socks I typically work out in, both socks had holes in the toe after my second workout while wearing them. I think at the very minimum, a sock should last through at least 3 workouts before wearing out. My feet would be happy to accept responsibility if any of my other socks had holes in them, but they don't, so they won't.
customer_reviews.author: jwdred

customer_reviews.title: Balega Socks "Pair" Well in My So-Called Athletic Life
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Balega socks for over five years now. They are so cushy and soft that I had to ban my fiance from wearing them (I very kindly bought him some pairs of his own so I am not a total non-sharing jerk). I absolutely recommend these socks for workouts, long runs, or just kicking it around the house. There is a little lip at the back of the sock that niftily fits over the heel of my running shoes, trainers, sneakers...whatever you prefer to call your kicks. Balegas are a little pricey but oh so worth it as they last for a long, long time. Lots of Amazon Love, Laurie
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Gannon, Work Play & Chardonnay

customer_reviews.title: Average high end sock
customer_reviews.text: Nice product with good comfort and breath ability. But feels quite a bit less comfy than feetures, with no l/r and front tab makes this a hard sale when comparing to the elite line from the competitor. Also not as durable in construction through wash cycles. Prefer cep for compression and injinji for toe socks and in every other way as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Best socks I have; for everyday too
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a pair of these at a local running shoe store for running, they're made more specifically for running shows so they're not going to be "hidden" in certain sneakers (such as Vans). I've bought more of these because of the extra padding in the toe area helps my feet handle shoes better (I have wide feet). They're expensive, but worth having a few pairs! It would be 5 stars if the price was lower or I got more pairs for the dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Xeek

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: These have become my favorite workout socks. I have purchased thinner socks on Amazon – they just don’t provide the support and comfort of the socks do. When you purchase thinner socks, running in them really does become difficult. With these socks they not only look good they actually feel good and are very functional. They wash very well as suck should. They don’t pill, they don’t change color overtime, they just are amazing. Yes they’re pricey or than other pairs but it’s definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: PKC

customer_reviews.title: Thick socks
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for running socks, heard a lot about Balega. The came nicely packed, sanitized, packed manually as sticker states. It’s high quality socks but I am not sure how to run in it, especially now, when it is hot during summer time. These socks hackbe so thick cushion. I am returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping PRO

customer_reviews.title: I use Balega socks for years, this batch was not the same!
customer_reviews.text: This was very disappointing. A brand I trust did not deliver. I ordered three pair of socks and they all had different sticker images, so I cannot say it was just one person who was off their game. On one pair, the sewing on the corner is horrible to the point it is not usable. The other two pair, there is something just not right where they are bunching at the toes. I have been wearing Balega for at least 7 years, and this was a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: MLWO

customer_reviews.title: Will put your old running socks to shame.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they’re pretty expensive for socks but since discovering these about a year ago, they are legit the only socks I’ll run in. I’ll even wear a dirty pair before resorting to subpar “regular” socks. They’re the perfect amount of cushion, great moisture wicking, and nice and short. I’d you’re on the fence about them, maybe don’t get them honestly because they will make all your other socks seem disappointing. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These weren't more comfortable than my regular socks--and my shins were hurting more than usual as I walked in them--and I didn't realize that the tops of these socks would be a bit lower than the top of my walking shoes, meaning that my shoes occasionally rub against my bare skin. Not worth the money. They were also tighter than I expected, and I don't know if they're supposed to be or if I should've gotten medium instead of small. Having worn them, I don't think I'm allowed to return them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Guido

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful socks!!! I recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful socks!!! I was using cotton socks for my running until a friend suggested me to start using the running socks. Thanks to the reviews on Amazon, I chose this and bought one (size: M). The feel is amazing; my foot doesnt move within the shoes (my shoe size is 8.5) . Sometimes I dont feel the socks. Moisture wicking is working really well. My feet sweats a lot; this sock doesnt stink even after a 10 mile run. Since I recently got it, I have washed it only few times. There are some socks which look worn out after few washes. This isnt one. Definitely will buy more. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good-looking socks
customer_reviews.text: I am an older woman who wears a size11-11 1/2 shoe. Women’s socks aren’t big enough. Balega size L work very well and come in feminine colors as well as black and white. My other problem with all socks is that socks designed for men, which fit my foot, are too skinny in the calf! These socks work because they’re short, but I wish I could find some longer ones for winter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dodson

customer_reviews.title: My go to for recovery after ultras
customer_reviews.text: Great socks for running these are my go to for recovery after ultras.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great socks but they do not fit "true to size"
customer_reviews.text: These socks totally have the feeling and comfort you'd expect from a $13-$15 price point, but the sizing chart is inaccurate. I wear US size 13 shoes. I originally ordered the XL as it recommends. They were entirely too big. I exchanged them for a large and everything fit like it was supposed to. In addition, I ordered their "silver" and "blister resist" models to similar effect. Most of you will probably do well to order a size down.
customer_reviews.author: C. Veraday

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily runs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for my husband who runs 6 miles daily. Usually his socks get holes sooner than later but this particular brand seems to last longer. He loves how soft and cushiony they are. They are not too thin not too thick, just perfect for the fall weather of Virginia. The cushion on the back above the heel keeps foot from rubbing against the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Isa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: If you like digging your sock out of your shoe all day then get these
customer_reviews.text: I've heard good things about these socks, so I decided to order a pair. Well, they were comfy standing up. However, as soon as I started walking in them, the heel disappeared into my shoe. So, I ordered a different size - same thing. I've spent half the day digging the heel of the sock out of my shoe! Then went back to my Bombas. Returning both pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Fit
customer_reviews.text: Got these the a few days ago and have been on a run and bike ride using them. It was around 90 degrees with 70% humidity. The socks wicked well and kept my feet comfortable. Being a cushioned sock which fit how I wear and select my shoe size and the cushion is firm providing good support and comfort. I appreciate the no-seam toes so there are no pinch or bind points like typical socks and the elasticity kept them snug to my feet, but not tight like a compression sock. I look and feel of good quality and I am going to enjoy wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: TrinityFlorida

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality socks
customer_reviews.text: I wore these socks for 3 days after I got them & they are already starting to develop a hole in toe. Same thing is happening with the other pair too. I will not buy them again or recommend them. They’re comfortable on the feet but I’m dissatisfied with their quality & durability.
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: comfortable - but they die in washer/dryer
customer_reviews.text: These socks are very comfortable and I like the design around the ankle as it does not slip inside my shoes when I'm at the gym cross training. They do however, sort of die in the washer and dryer and you can see what I mean in the photo. I recommend washing - then hanging them to dry, instead of throwing them into the dryer. These are expensive socks, so I'd like them to last for at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. DeKett

customer_reviews.title: Quality comfort
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me by a distance runner. He said the durability is long term and they're extremely comfortable. He is 100% correct on his description. I use them for general fitness walking, hiking, golf, and casual wear. The comfort level is a 10 on a 1-10 scale. They do an excellent job with moisture wicking. I'm very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Major Wood

customer_reviews.title: Best socks ever
customer_reviews.text: Super soft fabric and cushiony feel. The socks are cut as "no-show" (for running shoes) but are still cut high enough that your heels & talus will not chafe with normal running shoes. The entire sole is padded, which I also prefer. My favorite running socks among all the brands I've tried! Also they are still soft and cushiony after many uses & washes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Too cushioned and comfy to run in
customer_reviews.text: These socks are really soft and comfortable to wear without shoes but they are really thick . I kept trying to figure out why my runs were not going as well when I wore them and I think it’s just because they make my sneakers (Nike) too tight. I tried them last night with an older pair of sneakers that have a looser fit ( Brooks) and it was better. I bought three pairs of these and missed the return window. I’m going to try a different style of this brand to see if they work better. They aren’t cheap so now I feel like I should buy a new pair of larger sneakers so it isn’t a waste.
customer_reviews.author: LLombardo

customer_reviews.title: Best feel on my feet
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've ever reviewed socks, but these earn the bother. I borrowed a pair in an REI to try on shoes once upon a time. I didn't buy the shoes, but I did buy a pair of these socks while I was there. Worth every penny. The cushion and the fabric feel amazing. I ran a half marathon in them a couple weeks ago and the cushion with the thin top really did make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear2

customer_reviews.title: Best running socks
customer_reviews.text: I am a runner and wearing the right socks is almost as important as wearing the right running shoes. I've used Balega socks for quite some time and I am always happy with them. They stay in place, no need to be readjusting them as I run. My feet stay dry even though I run on the trails in GA, 90-95 degree weather. Perfect cushion and perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Doryys Leal

customer_reviews.title: Great but expensive
customer_reviews.text: These are certainly a nice and comfortable pair of socks. I absolutely love the heel flap that stops the sock from slipping down. I assume this feature is most helpful to an athlete but I am just a sweaty guy who is a big fan of cushioned socks.. Despite my love for the comfort of these socks I cannot agree that they are some how worth almost $15 a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel J. Einsohn

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: My dad has a really skinny heel and has had the hardest time finding no-show socks that will stay put and not slip down into his shoe. I finally convinced him to try Balega as I love them for running. He really likes the fit and thinks they are a winner! Will save him from the geeky over the ankle socks he has been wearing with his Sperry's for years!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Larmann

customer_reviews.title: good bye blisters
customer_reviews.text: these are hands down the best running socks. I only run in balegas now. Prior to transitioning solely to balega I had blisters constantly on my feet, since I have transitioned I have yet to have any blisters in 3 years. I average 60 or more miles weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wood

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a Balega fan
customer_reviews.text: For many years, I have worn Balega as a runner. I picked up some new ones in the fall of 2018 and right away noticed they were thinner and constantly slide off my heel even just walking in them. I assumed it was a fluke and purchased more in December 2018. I have tried to wear them for cross-fit, running, and walking. Every time they slip off my heel - there is a lack of elasticity. The fabric is cheaper and thinner than my old Balega's which are more than a year old. Don't waste money on this product - the quality is no longer there.
customer_reviews.author: john acken

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, But Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: I tried many brands of no-show socks, and they all had the same problem. The heel of the sock would soon work its way down until it was under the heel of my foot. I didn't try Balega because of their high cost. Then a friend told me he had the same problem until he found Belaga. Now I wear them, too. I don't know why, but they stay up where they belong.
customer_reviews.author: Thruppence

customer_reviews.title: Beware of sizing
customer_reviews.text: I've been a giant fan of these socks for years, but usually get the Ultralight for running. I ordered two pairs of these in medium (size 9.5/10) and they are FHUUUGE. They look and feel great otherwise, but had to give them to my husband. Massive disappointment. Could just be manufacturer's error and sent me a large instead of a medium, or I got a bogey, but be careful!
customer_reviews.author: mconnery

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic socks
customer_reviews.text: I really love these socks. I bought a pair at a running event a couple years ago and having been running a lot more recently I thought I should get a couple more pairs. They're super comfortable, soft, and have enough padding to prevent blisters in most cases. If I'm running particularly long or hard I wear another thin pair of socks underneath just in case, but I'll admit I haven't tried without the extra pair so maybe these socks are good just by themselves. They were great for my last half marathon and I'm hoping they'll hold up through the next couple as well. 10/10 will buy again when I need more.
customer_reviews.author: DameEdna

customer_reviews.title: Foot friend
customer_reviews.text: Worn at night to bed as well to help circulation and arthritic feet. Awesome upon awakening. A sock should have no inside threading or pilling issues- these are great that way. Color is sleek & fast. Love the fit-supportive but not constrictive, soft, washes well-didn't bleed. Wore them in extreme heat and my feet were not sweaty or dry- great for skin.
customer_reviews.author: Azul

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: They are a little on the thick side so just be aware. I always size up for my running shoes so its not an issue for me and I like the added comfort of the thicker areas of the sock. They stay in place when running which is a major plus! That was the most important criteria for this sock. Not to show and especially not to slip. Great sock, will definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyofthree

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps more suited for runners not working out.
customer_reviews.text: Way too thick and way too hot! Perhaps they are good for a runner considering the fact that they have ample cushioning but not for intense workouts. They don’t breathe very well at all. They also don’t fit very snug around the ankle area so when they are worn a few more times I’m guessing they will start sliding down. Complete waste of money I was hoping for something better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Brand sizing inconsistent. See picture, both a size Medium.
customer_reviews.text: Size is not consistent across Balega brand. I have worn Medium in other styles, two different styles shown in picture. One style, Hudden Comfort, is MUCH larger than the Ultra Light style. I rated only 3 stars because I am uncertain about the comfort and fit of the larger version, the Hidden Comfort style. I hope washing in hot water shrinks the socks. They “fit” in their pre-washed state, but are much looser and larger than other previously purchased styles across the same brand. I will provide this same input to Balega.
customer_reviews.author: Havanese Are Awesome

customer_reviews.title: My Son's Favorite Sock
customer_reviews.text: My college aged son ordered a pair of these, he thought it was for a pair of socks and not a single pair, and fell in love with them. He's a competitive runner and extremely hard to please when it comes to what goes on his feet. They're pricey but well fitting, comfortable & not too thick. He throws them in the washer & dryer at school and they have worn beautifully. They are his sock of choice for his running shoes. I will surprise him by purchasing more for him in the future since I'm not on a college student budget anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dribble Drabble

customer_reviews.title: Very thick
customer_reviews.text: I ended up giving to my fiance because it was a lot thicker than I thought it would be. It made my shoes fit too tight. Very comfortable though! If you want comfort, then I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Like discovering a whole new world of socks
customer_reviews.text: I’d have heard of this brand from relatives who run marathons. I am not an athlete, I am just barely trying to get into shape after decades of being out of shape. This sock is excellent for those who need support and just starting to begin to work out. I love the arch support and the lip on the ankle. Plan to buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: I have one pair of these and several other brands (powersox, dri-fit, etc). These are my "go to" socks. I just bought two more pair so that I don't have to worry about washing the one pair to have it ready for the next run or ride. Very soft, keep feet dry and comfortable (even on the long runs). The Dri-fits are ok, but I feel like they are "slippery" inside the shoe. These are more substantial and feel better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a runner, unfortunately and not of my own choice. I liked the sound of these to wear for all the times when I want some covering on my feet. These are SO great compared with the ones on sale everywhere. For one thing, they don't slip down off my heels, even if I sleep in them as foot warmers. They are also more cushioned and comfortable when I sometimes walk around on my wood floors with no shoes. I am so glad to have tried these and will definitely be buying some more.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: TOO LARGE - BUY SIZE DOWN
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have read the reviews before buying. $12 for ONE pair of socks and they're too big! I used the product sizing chart and got a Medium because I wear a women's size 7.5. Now I have slipper socks I can wear around the house but there's no way I can run in these. Way too big. They are also extra thick, so wouldn't fit well in my running shoes, and don't wick moisture away at all. Super disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best comfort running socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are so comfy and great for running. I have two pairs and will totally buy more. I need more cushion when I run since my feet tend to get tired and need more comfort. I’ve worn these socks running various seasons and holds up very well especially in the summer. For those who wrote Negative reviews not sure why but buy them for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Lange

customer_reviews.title: Only socks I want to run in.
customer_reviews.text: Only socks I want to run in. I run every day, at least a mile, sometimes wayyyy more, and I have 8 pairs of these now, so the days I can't run in a pair are few and far between. Wasn't Always like that.... They're comfortable no matter the distance. And they seem durable! My oldest pair is over 3 years old now, and again, I run often and also wear them for other activities and casually (though I do try to save them for runs). Will keep buying more when I'm able (as they are expensive). I don't care about color so I usually buy cheaper colors or when on sale.
customer_reviews.author: IJT

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I both love these socks we wear year round
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both love these socks we wear year round. In the winter we pull on the wool socks over top of these and the wool keeps our feet warm and these socks keep our feet feeling comfortable. A great feature of these socks is that you can put them on with one hand while standing up and holding on to something. If you can get a big toe inside the opening your foot just slides right in. A great design for folks getting up in years.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: These socks were too big, too hot, and created too much friction. They gave me blisters on my toes--tops and bottoms--and were generally miserable to exercise in. After 3 or 4 miles, the fabric on the bottom felt like razor wire cutting into my feet.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were a little tighter on my foot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small in these socks. I wish they had an XS. I normally wear a ladies size 9 shoe. These fit but I would like for them to fit a little tighter. Very comfy and thick though!
customer_reviews.author: Katie I. Irvin

customer_reviews.title: Favorite running socks ever, prevented blisters
customer_reviews.text: These socks were great when I was doing running and training. Other socks would give me blisters and I was having issues. I tried wearing one sock over another sock but it got too hot. These socks are so comfortable and once I started wearing them the whole blister issue went away completely. For everyday wear sometimes I prefer a lighter sock because I live in Florida and in the summer to have socks on like this are a bit too warm. Balega has some other socks that are lighter but I didn’t really try them for running so I’m not sure how they compare on the blister front.
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: More hype than anything else
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one pair of these socks to see if they were worth the price. They are very well made but not worth the price. Not good for wicking, slide off your feet, plus just rotates around your foot. Go buy a nice bundled pair with 3 or 4 pairs of socks for the same price, you will be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: sealand

customer_reviews.title: Good Sock. Not AS soft and plush as the white Balegas for some reason
customer_reviews.text: Balegas are hands-down the best socks I know of when it comes to ankle-height work out socks. I have 4 pairs. This blue pair I bought (x-large) is great but for whatever reason, is not quite as plush as the white pairs I have. Don't get me wrong, it is really good, but not AS good as the others. I am not sure why. I would buy again, though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Terry Gregg Jr.

customer_reviews.title: soft, but too hot for running
customer_reviews.text: They socks are very soft material, but did start to pill in the heels after 2 wears. These are thick and definitely not work out socks or good @ keeping moisture away. Disappointed on purchase especially after reading some good reviews. I'd pass on these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra bit of coin
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair and I see replacing my others with this brand as they wear out. Comfortable, supportive and the logo looks pretty cool as well. While I only bought the black pair, I like that there are several colors to choose from. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: AWinTN

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and functional for running
customer_reviews.text: These socks are amazing for running! Super comfortable for running long distances but not so thick that your feet sweat. They are low but still have a little extra cushion at the heel to make sure you don’t get any blisters. Would recommend to and runner friends
customer_reviews.author: william manley

customer_reviews.title: Great no show socks to wear with tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. They have great arch support, are very comfortable with cushion my feet. They're great at keeping my feet dry and are designed so they won't slide down on my heal. They are my go to socks whenever I wear my tennis shoes. Seller appropriately described them online. I highly recommend these socks and will buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Janice H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks, but Too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice socks... they keep the moisture of your feet, they are very comfortable, and they fit great... The reason that I gave them 3 stars is because they are incredibly expensive for 1 pair... Love the socks, but I would not buy them again. Too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burns

customer_reviews.title: incredible how much difference a good sock can make.
customer_reviews.text: I have never spent much money on my gym socks. For years I have bought packs of adidas socks at Costco and thought they were good enough even though they stretched out and wore through the heels very fast. I decided to splurge and get these socks and I'm SO glad I did. they are super soft, feel padded (which is nice because if you have thin-topped shoes, you won't feel the mesh or laces rubbing against your skin) and the tab is thick and sturdy. I ended up buying 5 pairs (there are some other colors if you search by the item name on amazon) and feel that the investment was absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ao

customer_reviews.title: Poor Workmanship!
customer_reviews.text: See picture. Looks to me like someone should be fired on the QA line. This is the inside of the sock. Hanging threads get stuck in your toes when you put it on. Am I supposed to cut the threads? I understand that I can return them but one of the reasons you buy online is convenience. Is this normal? My other Balega socks don't have this? Are these the real deal or knock-offs?
customer_reviews.author: Tazmaniac

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 11.5 US men’s shoes. I have a pair of these and wanted more. I was surprised because they were a little big/longer than the other pairs I owned. After washing and drying they are a little more fitted but still not perfect like the original pair I purchased. Still soft and comfortable, and I love the lip and the back.
customer_reviews.author: AllWheelDrive

customer_reviews.title: Great for Running
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend who is a marathon runner. Super comfortable, he said he noticed a considerable difference using these instead of his regular socks, especially over longer distances. He regularly runs over 15 miles each time and hasn't gotten blisters since I got him these socks. Highly recommend for distance runners.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Love these for long distance running and comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I try to only run in Balega socks!! They have eliminated so many issues for me that regular cotton socks created. Love the bright colors for being seen on the road. The fit was perfect. Cannot recommend enough, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: rcaseytx

customer_reviews.title: sizing seemed off
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these as I've heard great things about them but they were really thick compared to the Smartwool brand running sucks I usually wear and the sizing seemed to run large. I wanted them for running but they felt bulky in my running shoes. I ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: JJH2U16

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and won't leave your heel to rub against your shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Man these are comfortable. I especially like the filled section on the back of the heel. A major problem with short running socks is that they fall below the heel lip of the shoe and leave your ankle susceptible to chafing and blistering. The lip on the back makes that much more difficult. I'm sure it can still happen, but it stays in place quite well. The socks themselves are much heavier than I'm used to in a running sock, but on a 5 mile run in high humidity, my feet didn't feel any hotter and were perhaps slightly more comfortable that usual.
customer_reviews.author: SLav

customer_reviews.title: Best socks I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical to purchase 1 pair of socks for the price of my normal 9 pack I usually purchase from the box stores. But, these are totally worth it. They have a good amount of cushion, fit really nice and felt like clouds when I ran in them yesterday. Seriously, if you are on the fence, buy a pair and test them out, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: You will want more. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: Started getting these socks for the extra material on the back. Really protect your ankle from rubbing against those high cut sneakers/ shoes. Though i would wear a different sock for in the heat walking all day. If your feet sweat, these socks will capture all the sweat but the smell too.
customer_reviews.author: Rockdpm

customer_reviews.title: Best socks around!
customer_reviews.text: For years I’d worn the Hanes gray toe women’s socks you can get in a pack of ten at Target and such. My trainer turned me onto these and there’s no going back. I’ve recommended them to tons of people and they all fell in love. The thick cushioning on the bottom makes all the difference in the world. Plus whether I wear them with gym shoes or boots, my normally sweaty feet stay dry. Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Glenna Cathers

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these socks
customer_reviews.text: Since going through cancer treatment comfort has become king for me and I tried several different types of socks these are by far my favorite of all the ones I've tried. They are thick enough to be comfortable and cushioned feeling but wick away moisture keeping you comfortable. These will be all I buy in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Diappointed
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd Balega. I bought these on the strength of the first pairs. I liked how they held and wouldn't slip when I jogged. These however are looser and not as compressive. I am not happy about these given how much I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: aultraman

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the perfect sock!
customer_reviews.text: I wear socks around the cabin-my home-three seasons of the year. Finally broke down and ordered 4 pair of these and they are the best! Don’t really shrink after walking and being put in the dryer! Still just as comfortable as when they’re re new! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tina S. Matejka

customer_reviews.title: They actually fit my feet!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this line has specific sizes that fit feet better. Those one-size-fits-most “size 6 to 11” socks leave those of us with larger feet with much less fabric to work with. I have permanent blister lines on the back of my ankles from those tiny “one size fits most” socks slipping down into my shoe. (I’m a women’s size 8.5 / 9 and ordered a Medium)
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Best no show socks, ever.
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best no show socks on the planet..... every time I put them on, it's like heaven. I have cheaper alternatives that have the same bit of extra padding at the back (Asics); but I only purchased those because they are cheaper and you can buy in bulk. Those are good; these are GREAT. Not really on the same page. These Balega also stand up much better in the wash. If they sold a 20 pack for around $6 per pair instead of $10... I'd buy it. Yes, I'd spend that much on socks just so I could wear these every time I wear running shoes, Chucks, PF Fylers, Nikes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bill F.

customer_reviews.title: Fits really well
customer_reviews.text: I really like that these socks come in different sizes. I wear a size 6 shoe so often I have a sock that is "size 6-10" but is too long for my foot and bunches up near the toe. These are surprisingly soft, have a medium thickness, and are exactly as shown in the listing
customer_reviews.author: HallieS

customer_reviews.title: Runs large but most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 8.5 womens running shoe so I ordered a med sock. They run large. Had to exchange for a small. Sock is so comfortable, I've ordered more.
customer_reviews.author: paul koehn

customer_reviews.title: These socks hug my feet!
customer_reviews.text: The socks fit nice and snug with wiggle room for the toes. These are great for work as well as for exercise as my husband does manual labor and his feet get hot in the work shoes. Great price too. Can't lose with these socks!
customer_reviews.author: sdehav

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for everyday and for working out and hiking. They offer great arch support, comfort and keep my feet cool. Excellent quality. I have been wearing these for years when I discovered them at my running store while buying a new pair of running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: L. W.

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best, most comfortable workout socks ever! I bought a couple of pairs at an athletic store and liked them so much that I decided to order enough pairs to get through the week. I love the padding since I’m older and feel the need for extra padding for my feet during hard workouts!
customer_reviews.author: Janneke Bogyo

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for no slip socks
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable socks! They never slip down in your shoe when you’re walking which is the main reason I bought them to protect my feet from blisters. They’re thick but not overly thick. They keep my feet dry to prevent issues. I will only buy the grey or black going forward since the white didn’t wash as well. No issues with the quality but just looked picked. Get a pair and try them. You’ll definitely be ordering more like me!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: and they were perfect and snug and my new favorite sock
customer_reviews.text: Never buying these socks from Amazon again. I've purchased these in a Fleet Feet store, and they were perfect and snug and my new favorite sock. So I bought these hoping to avoid the 40 minute drive to Fleet Feet. I purchased the same size, but they are waaaay too big! I'm wondering if they are a knockoff? I honestly had to double check to see if I bought them in men's sizes! Gave them to my fiance and he likes them but I'm severely disappointed with this purchase because of the sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina J.

product_meta.title: Balega Hidden Comfort No-Show Running Socks for Men and Women (1 Pair)
product_meta.description: Balega Hidden Comfort No-Show Running Socks for Men and Women offer plush comfort and performance during long races and extended training sessions. Balega’s proprietary Drynamix fabric wicks moisture away from the skin, and specially constructed, reinforced microfiber mesh ventilation panels keep feet dry mile after mile. A hand-linked seamless toe box minimizes friction, preventing chafing on top of the foot. Toe and heel are reinforced for durability. The high heel tab and extra deep heel pocket prevent socks from slipping down into shoes, while the enhanced Elastane provides additional no-slip security. The Balega Hidden Comfort No-Show Running Socks feature high-volume, impact-resistant cushioning, and plush 200 needle-count fabric for race-tested foot protection during extended walks and runs.
feature_bullets: No-show cushioned running sock provides comfort and performance during extended training and activity
Proprietary Drynamix wicks moisture away from skin, and specially constructed, reinforced microfiber mesh ventilation panels keep feet dry
Hand-linked seamless toe box minimizes friction, preventing chafing on top of the foot; reinforced heel and toe for durability
High heel tab and extra deep heel pocket prevent socks from slipping down; enhanced Elastane provides additional no-slip security
High-volume impact resistant cushioning and plush 200 needle-count fabric offer race-tested foot protection
